alert.note: Alert for Orange County Inland; Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 08 at 9:56PM PST until November 09 at 7:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE BOND/SILVERADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Inland Areas and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * WHAT...Showers will continue to move across the burn scars, some could be moderate to locally heavy, possibly leading to minor flows. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Inland Areas and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall is possible but the threat is much less than earlier. Residents near the Bond/Silverado burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Inland; Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills
